speaker: Girl
text: Thank You. Now I can return to my service at Mila's Temple. ...! Hold on... Could it be?!

speaker: Celica
text: Hmm? What's the matter?

speaker: Girl
text: My apologies. You just bear a striking resemblance to Lady Liprica.

speaker: Celica
text: Liprica!? That was my mother's name!

speaker: Girl
text: Then... then you truly are Princess Anthiese! This is wonderful!

speaker: Celica
text: You knew my mother? Please... Tell me about her...

speaker: Girl
text: Yes... Lady Liprica was originally a priestess at Mila's Temple. The king, charmed by her beauty, forcibly made her his queen. It was hard for her to bear, and she soon caught a grave disease. Soon after she gave birth to you, she perished... She worried so about you... Oh, Lady Anthiese, don't cry... I have something I must give you.

speaker: Girl
text: This diadem proves you are the princess of Zofia. Please use your power to save the Kingdom.

speaker: Girl
text: I am returning to Mila's Temple. Take care, Your Highness.

speaker: Alm
text: Everyone, stay alert! A brigade from Rigel is closing in. Fortify our defenses! Scatter our foes and pick them off one by one!

speaker: Desaix
text: The rebel forces are attacking? Shit! In that case... Archers! Kill that girl in her cell as a warning!

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Hoho... You fools hope to beat me, Lord Tatarrah? Delthea! Kill those idiots with your Aura!

speaker: Delthea
text: Ah! My head... What am I doing here? Urgh... Luthieeer--

speaker: Grieth
text: Hehe... Foolish brats. Have a death wish? I, Lord Grieth, will show you my power. Get 'em, boys! Kill them all!

speaker: Celica
text: Look! The Temple of Mila! Stay alert-- Mikhail, one of Duma's cantors, is ahead. Everyone, protect out frailer allies!

speaker: Npc
text: A liberation soldier is imporisoned in Desaix's fort. Rumors say she'll be executed soon. You guys better hurry if you want to save her!

speaker: Npc
text: Valentia is split by a deep gorge. The floodgate exists to store water in the gorge, but... if it isn't opened periodically, the water overflows

speaker: Npc
text: The Rigelian army has occupied the gate and is keeping it closed. Please, Lord Alm. You must somehow open the gate before Zofia floods!

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: Some Gargoyles flew off to the shrine in the west with my child. If you save her, I'll give you my treasure.

speaker: Unnamed Girl
text: Wahh! I was so scared!

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: Thank you.

speaker: Unnamed Girl
text: Eheh. Thanks for saving me.

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: What? You want me to open the floodgate!? If I do that, the water will pour out too fast, causing a flood. Sorry, but until the floodgate at Mila's Temple is opened, I can't do it.

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: Oh! Mila's floodgate has been opened! I'll open this gate right away!

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: North of this floodgate is the Kingdom of Rigel. Be careful.

speaker: Palla
text: Catria! Those guys are bandits. Stay close!

speaker: Npc
text: The bandit king Grieth rules the eastern desert. He attacked and took all of our children as slaves. What should we do...?

speaker: Npc
text: Some say the dead can be revived in the nearby shrine. Dragons have settled there, though. Anything that draws near gets devoured.

speaker: Npc
text: The Earth Goddess Mila was sealed by King Rudolf of Rigel. That's why the land is barren. As things stand, we'll all starve...

speaker: Npc
text: Great Cantor Dolth rules the land north of here. Tresspass, and he'll summon necrodragons to devour you.

speaker: Npc
text: Travelling north is impossible with the gorge full of water. If you don't open the western floodgate, the water won't drain. There's a reserve gate in this temple's basement, but...

speaker: Npc
text: The evil god Duma gave Rudolf the sword that sealed Lady Mila. If you go to the Tower of Duma, you could rescue her. Just beware of the life-draining swamps on the way...

speaker: Npc
text: One of our priestesses is a prisoner in Grieth's fort. Please, save everyone captured by that evil thief!

speaker: Girl
text: Thanks to you, our healer returned safely. If you go north, look for a hamlet in the Lost Treescape. The Great Sage Halcyon who lives there ought to help you somehow.

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: I'm the guard of this floodgate. What? You want me to open it? No can do. Only the Zofian royal family can order this gate opened. I ain't listening to you!

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: Hmm? Wait a sec... That crown...! That's the royal family's crest! Then you must be the long-lost Princess Anthiese!F-forgive my rudeness. I'll open the floodgate straightaway.

speaker: Unnamed Man
text: Your Highness, the western floodgate must also be open to drain the water.

speaker: Luthier
text: I beg of you, please save my little sister! She's being manipulated by the cantor Tatarrah at Rigel's sluice. If Tatarrah is defeated, the spell on Delthea should break...

speaker: Mathilda
text: Thank you. I just knew you'd come rescue me.

speaker: Delthea
text: I don't know what happened, Brother. Eh? I was under Tattarah's control? So that's what it was... I'm sorry if I've been a bother.

speaker: Palla
text: Oh! I was looking for you. Our sister, Est, is still missing and I was thinking... Your journey will be tough, like ours. May we travel together? We can help each other out.

speaker: Catria
text: Ahh, I hope we find Est soon... This is a secret, but if the three of us surrounded a foe, there's a really cool move we can use.

speaker: Atlas
text: Y'guys gonna go finish off that bastard, Grieth? If so, let me help out. My siblings got captured by him, but I don't know where they're at...

speaker: Jesse
text: Aw, thanks. You saved me. Name's Jesse. Just some merc. I got caught helping out a girl jailed in Grieth's fort. Cute kid from a foreign land.

speaker: Celica
text: That has to be Est... Hey, Jesse. Is there a way we can save her?

speaker: Jesse
text: Nope. There's no way the few of us can do anything.

speaker: Celica
text: But there must be a way...

speaker: Jesse
text: Well, I guess... Grieth has these two underlings: Sonya and Deen. They guard the north and south desert regions, respectively. Both of them seem to hate Grieth. However, neither will betray him while the other's alive. If you defeat one, the other may become your ally. Oh, and of course I'll lend you a hand, too.

speaker: Est
text: Eh? Big sisters! Ahh, great! I'm coming with you guys too!

speaker: Sonya
text: What, you've dealt with Grieth? Well, that vile man had it coming. Mmm... I owe you guys one, eh? I gotcha. I'll lend you a hand.

speaker: Deen
text: What, you've dealt with Greith? Well, that vile man had it coming. Mmm... I owe you guys one, eh? Very well. I'll lend you a hand.

speaker: Delthea
text: For defying Lord Tatarrah... Die!

speaker: Delthea
text: Ahh, it hurts... B-brother...

speaker: Deen
text: No hard feelings, but we're enemies. Taste my blade!

speaker: Sonya
text: Heheh, little girl and company-- you're going to die!

speaker: Desaix
text: Is this all you've got...? I won't be beaten so easily!

speaker: Desaix
text: Grr... Mycen! Is he planning to give Zofia to Rudolf's brat?! Damn traitor!

speaker: Tatarrah
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Grieth
text: Grr, is this already the end of my kingodm? Then I'll drag you all down with me to hell!

speaker: Grieth
text: I hope you're proud! How could I-- ugh...

speaker: Unnamed Sage
text: If you go down these stairs you should get to Duma's Altar. It's said that there's no return once you've entered. Your Highness, please take care!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: Ah! Alm, help us... At this rate, everyone will... H-hurry... Please...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica?!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Don't worry. I'll crush these bastards.

speaker: Celica
text: It won't work. Jedah somehow seals all attacks. Plus, Mogalls keep spawning and entangling us. We're done for... Sorry, Alm. I was weak after all. I've had an odd premonition that pain awaits you... That's why I left on a quest to save Mila... That's why I didn't want you to fight yet. I'm sorry I acted so cold... The truth is, I've always...

speaker: Alm
text: I understand. But Celica! Focus on escaping! I'll definitely save you, so hang on!

speaker: Jedah
text: You fools... You will regret this...

speaker: Marla
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Hestia
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Duma
text: That's enough... Hero Alm. Inherit our will and rule this land fairly... Carry both Duma's power and Mila's love... You must never repeat these events... Never again disturb our slumber...

speaker: Mycen
text: Alm, rest. Your sword training is over. Go and play, but don't leave the village. Bandits have been about.

speaker: Gray
text: Yo Alm! Listen to this guy!

speaker: Lukas
text: The infamous General Desaix has initiated a coup. Zofia's castle was captured and the king has been killed. We formed a liberation force to fight agains Desaix, but it's not good enough. So, I cam to ask General Mycen to help.

speaker: Mycen
text: Alm, you came...

speaker: Alm
text: Gramps! Why are you at Zofia Castle?

speaker: Mycen
text: I can't seem to escape destiny. Alm, it's best if you follow your own path. Free this land of Valencia from its cursed fate. You and the red-haired girl who will visit this castle soon... Perhaps that is what fate has in store for you...

speaker: Gray
text: We'll wait here. Ask your old man!

speaker: Tobin
text: Our country's people need us. Let's help 'em!

speaker: Kliff
text: Your old man was a General?

speaker: Mycen
text: What? Join the liberation forces?! I won't allow it! War brings only sorrow...

speaker: Python
text: Stop right there. Suspicious people may not pass. Eh? You're new recruits? In that case, go on inside, but be careful! Demons may be around.

speaker: Npc
text: Thanks to you all, Desaix's army fled to their own fort in the western forest.

speaker: Npc
text: Desaix escaped with the valuable 'Royal Sword'. It was a gift of friendship from the Kingdom of Rigel long ago. No normal person can use it.

speaker: Npc
text: The entire royal family was murdered by Desaix. Well, except the princess whom Lord Mycen was entrusted with.

speaker: Npc
text: Take this Ridersbane. Those who can use it can easily dispatch enemy knights.

speaker: Npc
text: It seems that Desaix has requested aid from Rigel. If he's not stopped before the Rigelian army comes, there'll be big trouble.

speaker: Npc
text: You're General Mycen's grandson? But he shouldn't have any kin... N-no way, that rumor was true?

speaker: Npc
text: Desaix secretly had every child born to the royal family killed. Sir Mycen tried to stop him but was charged with the crime instead and driven away.

speaker: Lukas
text: No good, huh?... Too bad. Sir Mycen has grown cowardly in his old age. To think he was once called Zofia's hero...

speaker: Alm
text: Wait-- I'll join in place of Gramps.

speaker: Lukas
text: Eh? You'll come in his stead? Thank you. My comrades will be pleased. Let's go to the liberation's base.

speaker: Gray
text: Alm, I'm going with ya. This village is bound to get attacked, too, so let's beat up that Desaix guy first.

speaker: Tobin
text: Of course we're all coming, Alm, you're our leader! Let's go take back Zofia's castle!

speaker: Kliff
text: Me!? ... Well... alright, I'll go with ya. But help me if I get in trouble!

speaker: Silque
text: I'm Silque, a priestess in the service of Mila. I was brought here by bandits. Please let me come with you.

speaker: Clair
text: Thanks for saving me. I'm Clair of the Knights of Zofia. My older brother Clive leads the liberation force. Let's go to the base together.

speaker: Clive
text: So, you're Alm? Thank you for saving my sister. Well, I've got a favor to ask of you. Starting today, will you lead our forces? That's why we sought Sir Mycen, Zofia's hero, but for some reason, he's refused us. Therefore, I'd like you to command our units in his place. So, Alm. I'm counting on you to save Zofia.

speaker: Forsyth
text: Desaix requested aid from Rigel, up north. If Rigel complies, we won't stand a chance!

speaker: Alm
text: But the 'Gods' Pact' upheld by Zofia and Rigel... It means we won't war, right? Our guardian, Lady Mila, would never allow it.

speaker: Forsyth
text: Yeah, well... There's a rumor that Lady Mila has disappeared. Hey, hey! Don't look so surprised! After all, it's been strange lately, hasn't it? Crops failing, odd demons emerging... Only Mila's Temple knows what's goin on, I guess.

speaker: Python
text: What? We're finally marching on Zofia Castle? I'm coming too! Be wary of Slayde, the guards' captain. He's a pretty strong fighter.

speaker: Desaix
text: Rebel scum! Think you can defeat me? Slayde, use my army to scatter those swines!

speaker: Slayde
text: Die, rebels!

speaker: Desaix
text: What?! Slayde's been downed?! Shit! I'll remember this. I'm leaving this to you, men!

speaker: Slayde
text: Heh... Fools! What you just beat was a double. Lord Desaix left for his own lands already. I'll pay you back for this someday.

speaker: Celica
text: Well, Bishop Nomah, I'll be off.

speaker: Nomah
text: Celica... Must you go? The road to Mila's Temple is long. Between Geyse's pirates and the evil fiends rising, you'll surely be attacked. It's too risky...

speaker: Celica
text: But Father, it's been three years since we last grew crops. What in the world befell the Earth Goddess Mila? I want to find out for myself.

speaker: Nomah
text: I see... If you insist, then I shall not stop you, Celica. You know why Sir Mycen placed you in my care, right? You are the last of the Zofian royal family. Zofia's people depend on you. Don't try to do the impossible.

speaker: Mycen
text: Celica, it's been a while, eh?

speaker: Celica
text: ...? Grandfather! Why are you here?!

speaker: Mycen
text: Well, for many reasons... I see you've arrived safely.

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, thanks to my allies. We're all going to Mila's Temple.

speaker: Mycen
text: I see... Well, you might want to head upstairs first. You should find someone you've been wishing to meet.

speaker: Celica
text: It...it can't be! ...Alm? Zofia's liberator couldn't be Alm... could it?

speaker: Mycen
text: Well, why don't you go see?

speaker: Alm
text: ...? You are... Ce...Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... So it really was you. I haven't seen you since I left the village...

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah. We always used to play together. I held a serious grudge against Gramps the day you were sent away.

speaker: Celica
text: I was sad too, but Grandfather told me why he did it: 'If you stay in Ram, Desaix will come to kill you.'

speaker: Alm
text: But why? Why would Desaix want to kill you, Celica?

speaker: Celica
text: That... I'm sorry. I'd rather not say right now. In any case, Alm, I have a request. Can war be avoided with the Kingdom of Rigel?

speaker: Alm
text: That's impossible. King Rudolf of Rigel decided to attack while Zofia is weak. At this rate, Zofia will be destroyed.

speaker: Celica
text: But aren't we all the same? We should be able to coexist.

speaker: Alm
text: There's no way. Zofians won't tolerate Rigel's barbaric rule. We must retaliate!

speaker: Celica
text: How sad... I'm sure if we talked, we could come to an understanding... Unless, Alm, now that the Zofians call you their hero, you want to become their king as well?

speaker: Alm
text: What! That's mean, Celica. I just want to protect the people of Zofia, that's all. Besides, Zofia's only remaining princess is still alive. I'm planning to search for her. After I find her, I'm returning to Ram.

speaker: Celica
text: That's not true! Zofia's royal family is gone! But I get it, Alm. You go ahead to Rigel. My companions and I are going to Mila's Temple.

speaker: Alm
text: Celica!?

speaker: Celica
text: Goodbye, Alm...

speaker: Nomah
text: May the blessings of Mila be with you...

speaker: Npc
text: It's said a powerful sword is hidden at the Seabound Shrine.

speaker: Npc
text: Don't go near the Seabound Shrine, 'kay? A scary Necrodragon lives on that island and eats all trespassers.

speaker: Npc
text: If you want to sail to Valentia, take that docked ship. However, lots of pirates trawl the waters. Their boss, Barth, has killed many people.

speaker: Npc
text: Earlier, some men left to avenge their families. They probably won't return alive.

speaker: Palla
text: We came from Archanea, a continent to the east.

speaker: Catria
text: Our little sister was taken by pirates. We gave chase, but lost them around here.

speaker: Npc
text: A hero has arrived in Zofia! We're saved!

speaker: Npc
text: You'd better not go to Mila's Temple. That area's crawling with Geyse's bandits.

speaker: Npc
text: Hurrah! Zofia Castle is liberated! Desaix fled to his own lands!

speaker: Npc
text: Sure, I'm happy... But I'm a bit worried that the Kingdom of Rigel might invade...

speaker: Npc
text: Desaix's gone, but crops are wilting and weird demons emerged... What's happened to the Earth Goddess Mila?

speaker: Npc
text: Desaix escaped with the valuable 'Royal Sword'. It was a gift of friendship from the Kingdom of Rigel long ago. No normal person can use it.

speaker: Mae
text: That Boey's just a kid who only knows Fire magic. I can also use Thunder, so please rely on me, 'kay?

speaker: Boey
text: You must feel uneasy with just the girls, right? I'll come along too, so please relax.

speaker: Genny
text: If Lady Celica is going, then I shall go too. If you get hurt, I can heal you with my Recover spell.

speaker: Saber
text: Oh, shaddaaap! Dun interrupt my drinkin'! Don't gooo... Y'all can't cross the sea by yerselves, can ya?

speaker: Celica
text: Aren't you a mercenary? Could you protect us?

speaker: Saber
text: What? You wanna hire me? Hmm... Alright, it might be interestin'.

speaker: Valbar
text: You helped us out there. I owe ya one! Wherever ya go, I'll follow!

speaker: Kamui
text: Me? Well, I can join y'all if you like. ...Unless you're gonna fight the Necrodragon. There's no way to defeat that thing without Angel magic.

speaker: Leon
text: If my bro Valbar's going, then I am too. I'll show you my marksmanship!

speaker: Valbar
text: Kamui, Leon, don't slip up! If Barth is defeated, his goons should flee. Bring down Barth!

speaker: Barth
text: You've got nerve attackin' me, the pirate lord Barth! I'll dice ya!

speaker: Unnamed Enemy
text: Boss died! Run!

speaker: Halcyon
text: I am Halcyon. Hmm... You have come here seeking the missing Mila? The sword that sealed Mila lies under the Tower of Duma. However... Jedah will not allow you to draw near. If there is anything I can do, I will lend you my power.

speaker: Celica
text: I have nothing to ask of you. I'd like to help him...

speaker: Halcyon
text: I understand. I shall bless him with newly awakened powers.

speaker: Jedah
text: Heheh... Celica. Alm's trapped in the Dragon's Maw. Follow me if you want to save him. If you sacrifice yourselves to lord Duma, Alm's path shall again open up!

speaker: Jedah
text: Heheh, so you're finally here. This is Duma's Altar, our site of human suffering. Thus, I shall kill you slowly and painfully. Your pain will be Lord Duma's magnificent feast...

speaker: Alm
text: Ah, Gramps-- what the hell is going on!? How could such an evil man as King Rudolf be my father?!

speaker: Mycen
text: Alm. Your shock is understandable... But now you are the only remaining heir of Rigel's royal family.

speaker: Alm
text: But why... Why couldn't I avoid fighting my own father?

speaker: Mycen
text: Don't cry, Alm... Let me clarify your father's actions. Valentia became divided because of the gods. They have involved themsleves too deeply with mankind's affairs. As a result, the people have lost balance and head for ruin. After some consideration, Rudolf posed as a destroyer to investigate the advent of true heroes in Valentia. I was told this when he placed his newborn child into my hands: "This child will consign himself to hell's fire!" I couldn't refuse him. And so, I left all to fate. Alm. You mustn't let Rudolf's sacrifice be in vain. Go underground and slay the evil god Duma!

speaker: Halcyon
text: The Tower of Duma lies just ahead. Take caution.

speaker: Npc
text: You guys saved General Zeke, eh? Though I hate Zofians, I must thank you guys.

speaker: Npc
text: General Jerome was a cruel man. Even this village was sacked until Lord Zeke came.

speaker: Npc
text: Just ahead is the Dragon's Maw. The necrodragons there'll tear you apart!

speaker: Npc
text: General Zeke has no memories of his past. Lady Tatiana found him washed ashore with an awful wound and nursed him back to health.

speaker: Npc
text: This is the hidden Sage's Hamlet. It is protected by Master Halcyon, the Great Sage.

speaker: Npc
text: Master Halcyon was the High Priest of Lord Duma. However, he lost a dispute with the shaman Jedah and fled here. If you wish to fight him, there is only one way. On turn 4, 8, 12... Ugh... I... Jedah's spell has...

speaker: Massena
text: Prince Albein. I am General Massena, the captain of the king's guards. We have heard our late King's final words and assembled here.

speaker: Massena Soldiers
text: Long live King Rudolf the second!

speaker: Unnamed Sage
text: Your Highness, please listen to what Lord Mycen has to say.

speaker: Alm
text: What are you doing imprisoned here?

speaker: Tatiana
text: My love, Zeke, is a general of Rigelian knights. He opposed the war, however. To ensure he didn't rebel, I was taken hostage. If Zeke sees me rescued, I'm sure he'll gladly help you.

speaker: Zeke
text: You're Alm, the one who saved Tatiana, aren't you? Thank you kindly.

speaker: Alm
text: General Zeke, you oppose this war, correct? Please, join our cause.

speaker: Zeke
text: I cannot. I only helped you fight Jerome because he made my people suffer greatly. Besides... I don't know who I am. All I can remember is that I washed up on Rigel's shore. To my pitiful self, His Majesty Rudolf gave me a new life. I will not betray him.

speaker: Alm
text: I understand... Apologies for my rudeness.

speaker: Zeke
text: No, not at all... Hm!? Alm, what's that mark on your right arm?

speaker: Alm
text: Mark?... Ah, I've always had this birthmark. What does it...?

speaker: Zeke
text: I see... His Majesty Rudolf once told me: "Zeke, if you find the one with a cross-shaped birthmark on his right arm, you must dedicate yourself to that person. He will certainly become the savior of all of Valentia..." If this is His Majesty's will, then so be it! Al, I shall fight with you!

speaker: Nomah
text: Celica! Are you okay?

speaker: Celica
text: Bishop Nomah! Why in the world are you here?

speaker: Nomah
text: I got worried and followed you. Then I accidentally fell down here. Haha, what a folly! Well, from now on, I'm coming along with you. That'll ease my mind.

speaker: Jedah
text: Hehe, cute critter, eh? I didn't expect you to kill it so soon. That brat was named Alm, yes? If you do not wish to lose him, girl... climb the Tower of Duma.

speaker: Rudolf
text: I see, so you've come at last... I leave this to fate now as a knight of Rigel. Men! You have fought well thus far! However... The Rigelian Empire's time has ended. Hear me, all of you! This is my final request. If I should fall, don't interfere. Those remaining should surrender courageously. Do not feel disgraced! Is that clear? Don't die in vain!

speaker: Zeke
text: What? Tatiana was saved? Very well! All troops, engage Jerome's men!

speaker: Zeke
text: Well... If I must fight... Forgive me.

speaker: Marla
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Arise, Medusa! Now is the time you must fulfill your contract with me!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: I... I have erred...

speaker: Jerome
text: You bastards pleased?

speaker: Dolth
text: ...Gwehehe... Oh, defiled beings who rule this foul swamp, repel these men as Master Jedah ordered! May they fall to the necrodragons that I, Shaman Dolth, summon from the dark realm!

speaker: Dolth
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Jamil
text: May Duma's blessings--

speaker: Magnus
text: As expected, even I fell...

speaker: Rudolf
text: Alm... You've grown up well... Was it no mistake entrusting you to Sir Mycen after all? You figured it out by now, right? Your full name is Albein Alm Rudolf. My... only son... Guh... I have a last request... Use 'Falchion', the holy sword that sealed Mila... Defeat... the evil god... Duma...
